title: Integrated BIM and IFC-Based Architectural Education Design Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational architectural design, CAD software proficiency, basic mathematical/geometric concepts
context.additional_context: Training program for pre-service teachers to expand the application of BIM/IFC in Cambodian architectural education, enhancing practical skills through project-based learning in a digitally supported environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of BIM (Building Information Modeling) and architectural application cases of the IFC (Industry Foundation Classes) standard.
Learners can generate simple building models (IFC-compatible) using BIM software such as Revit/ArchiCAD.
Learners can perform BIM-based spatial analysis (area calculation, clash detection, etc.) through team projects and visualize results as mathematical data.
Learners can propose an instructional design framework for integrating BIM learning activities into architectural curricula.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
